sentences.english: The report cites Brazil that could benefit politically with population growth.
sentences.chinese: 報道引用到巴西人口增長可以使其政治上獲利。

sentences.english: He has a profit on everything he sells.
sentences.chinese: 他賣出每樣東西都獲利。

sentences.english: They derived a benefit from that transaction.
sentences.chinese: 他們從那筆交易中獲利。

sentences.english: Unless we have healthy pigs we cannot have a profitable pig industry.
sentences.chinese: 只有健康的養豬，才能從養豬業獲利。

sentences.english: It allowed for re-entry and rewards for investors willing to brave some risk.
sentences.chinese: 這讓重新進入和想要獲利的投資者們願意去面對風險。

sentences.english: Money earns more in a high interest account.
sentences.chinese: 錢放在高利息的帳戶裏獲利多。

sentences.english: Does that mean there won't be profits to be made by cynically holding your nose and investing in the moment?
sentences.chinese: 就是說，不能強捏着鼻子投資獲利在當下咯？

sentences.english: Effective cash administration must take both liquidity and earning efficiency into account.
sentences.chinese: 有效的現金管理是必須兼顧其流動性與獲利性。

sentences.english: They sold jade at a huge profit.
sentences.chinese: 他們賣了那塊玉，獲利很高。

sentences.english: She makes sure her dealings are profitable; her lamp burns late into the night.
sentences.chinese: 她知道自己的經營獲利，她的燈終夜不滅。

sentences.english: Profit-taking is likely next week as swine flu will weigh on investor sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 下週獲利回吐很可能因爲豬流感，將加重投資者情緒。

sentences.english: Shareholders benefited from the premium prices on LBO offers.
sentences.chinese: 股東們因槓桿收購債券的發行溢價而獲利甚豐。

sentences.english: Kraft stands to lose not only a lucrative business but also some "category captaincies".
sentences.chinese: 卡夫不僅失去了獲利頗豐的業務而且部分領軍地位。

sentences.english: Seeing both parties to this transaction benefit equally is for me what this is all about.
sentences.chinese: 看到交易的雙方能夠平等地獲利對我而言就是全部。

sentences.english: Dividends are not a distribution of earnings paid to investors by a company or a fund.
sentences.chinese: 股息是一家自己搞或基金給投入資金者的獲利分配。

definition: to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
to sell/to reach (a price in an auction)
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
to convert (an asset) into cash/to cash out
